Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (989) 758-2717.

ALLEGATIONS: Staff are being too rough with Youth A. Youth A’s eczema is not
being treated. Staff left him at a trauma facility alone. Other youth are bullying Youth
A and staff are not doing anything. Youth A’s hygiene needs are not being met.
Youth A is not having visits with family.
INVESTIGATION:
On 10/19/20, I spoke to Administrator 1. Allegations were discussed and scheduling set
up for interviews on 10/27/20.
On 10/26/20, I received a phone call from Administrator 1. Administrator 1 reported
youth are getting tested for Covid-19. Results did confirm positive test results.
The following documents were reviewed throughout the course of the investigation:
 Youth A’s treatment plan
 Youth A’s hygiene log
 Medication Administration Review (MAR)
2

 Youth A’s Hygiene Plan
 CAP for investigation 2020C0108062 completed 9/24/20
All interviews were completed face to face at the facility. They were completed on
12/9/20. Youth A was discharged on 12/8/20.
Due to multiple allegations, each allegation will be addressed individually.
Allegation 1: Staff are being too rough with Youth A. Other youth are bullying
Youth A and staff are not doing anything.
I interviewed Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E. All reported that staff are not too
rough with the youth. All reported that staff intervene when youth are arguing with each
other.
Staff 1, Youth Care Worker, reported no one ever hurt Youth A. Staff 1 reported youth A
was not bullied. Staff 1 reported Youth A would mutually argue with other youth in the
unit.
Supervisor 1, Team Supervisor, reported Youth A could be aggressive. Supervisor 1
reported Youth A was never hurt by staff or received injuries from a restraint.
Administrator 2, Residential Care Coordinator, reported Youth A was not bullied.
Therapist 1 reported Youth A would discuss restraints in therapy sessions. Therapist A
reported Youth A never stated he was hurt from the restraints. Therapist 1 reported she
had never seen a staff hurt Youth A.
Allegation 2: Staff left him at a trauma facility alone.
Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 reported the staff had to transport Youth A to the
trauma center for an assessment. The staff were not allowed to enter into the
assessment room with Youth A. Youth A was only left alone when entering into the
assessment room.
Allegation 3: Youth A is not having visits with family.
Staff 2, Case Manager, reported Youth A’s guardian had an open door to therapy
appointments due to her living in Ohio. Staff 2 reported Youth A’s guardian did not show
up.
Therapist 1 reported Youth A had one face to face visit with his mother on 11/23/20.
Therapist 1 reported they had zoom meetings every Wednesday.
I reviewed case notes documenting visits. All visits were accounted for.
Allegation 4: Youth A’s eczema is not being treated.
3

Staff 1, Youth Care Worker, Supervisor 1, and Therapist 1 reported Youth A would not
take his medication for eczema all the time.
Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 reported he did take his medication sometimes.
I reviewed the MAR report for October, November, and December. The MAR report only
noted three attempts made to give Youth A his medication for eczema.
I reviewed the Medication Control and Administration Procedures Policy:
All WHS staff that are trained to administer medication will document the
following:
Client Name, Medication and dosage administered, time and date of
administration, and any client refusals. This is documented on an electronic
medication administration record (QuickMAR) in the client record.
Allegation 5: Youth A’s hygiene needs are not being met, specifically hair care.
I reviewed SIR 2020C0108062 and subsequent CAP. A Hygiene Plan was created.
I reviewed the specific hygiene plan for Youth A created on 9/24/20 until 12/8/20:
 Staff will direct Youth A to brush his hair if needed. Staff will log if refused or if he
attempted…
 Youth A will be given the opportunity to shower each night…will repeat if
necessary…staff will log shower times and attempts
 All information regarding Youth A’s personal hygiene will need to be logged each
hour. After completion or refusal of steps in this plan will need to be logged in his
hygiene log.
I reviewed his hygiene log. The logging was not completed in its entirety. There are
multiple days that do not have any logging noted and there are days where logging is
sporadic and not completed throughout the day.
I reviewed the Updated Treatment Plan, specifically under Life Skills for 8/16/20-
11/14/20. The treatment plan discusses the development and implementation of the
hygiene log. The logging is to be completed daily. It will log “prompting, demonstration,
and completion or non-completion of all hygiene tasks…”
4

APPLICABLE RULE:
R 400.4158 Discipline
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe discipline,
including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted I any manner.
ANALYSIS: All residents and staff interviewed did not report Youth A being
hurt by staff.
CONCLUSION: No Violation Established
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4142 Health Services; policies and procedures
An institution shall establish and follow written health
service policies and procedures addressing all of the
following:
(c) Documentation of medical care and maintenance of
health records
ANALYSIS: The MAR documentation is not completed. All staff interviewed
reported they attempted to provide the medication, but Youth A
would refuse. Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 reported Youth A would
take the medication at different times. None of these attempts or
refusals were noted from October 2020-December 8 2020.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLLISHED
SIR 2021C0106007
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program Statement
An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing resident’s
needs, implementation of service plans, and discharge of
residents.
5

ANALYSIS: A CAP implemented on 9/24/20 specifically addressed the lack
of life skills/hygienic needs for Youth A. The agency created a
hygiene plan for Youth A but did not follow that plan. The
agency failed to implement the service plans, addressing the
needs of the youth.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR 2021C106006
